pullRequest.body:
Refactors and expands the API for adic completions. More precisely:

- Renames `adicCompletion` to `AdicCompletion`.
- Redefines `adicCompletion` in terms of a `transitionMap`.
- Introduces `AdicCauchySequence` as the module of `I`-adic Cauchy sequences.
- Provides a surjective linear map `AdicCauchySequence I M →ₗ[R] AdicCompletion I M` and an induction principle for `AdicCompletion I M` for that.

---

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

using the following format:

-->

nodes.body:
This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#12511~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (🤖). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
Thanks a lot for all the suggestions @erdOne. I think I addressed them as you suggested.

Besides applying your suggestions, I added an `ext` lemma for `AdicCauchySequence` and renamed the `val_add` (etc.) lemmas for `AdicCauchySequence` to `add_apply` (etc.) (in accordance with `Pi.add_apply`).

Thanks!
maintainer merge
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by erdOne.

Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8913660591/job/24479609992)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8913660591/job/24479609499)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8913660591/job/24479609816)

Thanks for the quick response!
Some more nitpicks:

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion simp? ```

Maybe we can define this to be `{ f // ∀ {m n} (hmn : m ≤ n), AdicCompletion.transitionMap I M hmn (f n) = f m }` and ditch `adicCompletion` entirely? Similarly for `adicCauchySequence` (maybe replace it with a predicate `IsAdicCauchy`)
How do I then get the `AddCommGroup` and `Module` instances? Do I have to write them by hand? Currently they are inherited by `adicCompletion` being a `Submodule`.

And I have realized that `adicCompletion` should not be private after all, since it comes in handy again for defining the algebra instance. Maybe rename `adicCompletion` in `submodule` and define `AdicCompletion` as you suggest? Then I think `inferInstanceAs <| AddCommGroup (submodule I M)` should still work.

I suppose the proof that pointwise add and smul works is exactly the same proof as showing `adicCompletion` is a submodule. But if you will need it elsewhere then I think your suggestion is the way to go.
I think I changed it according to your suggestions.
Can you add `(transitionMap I M hmn (transitionMap I M hnk x)) = transitionMap I M (hmn.trans hnk) x` as a simp lemma?
Same here.

```suggestion
      rw [h hkl]⟩
```

```suggestion
      Submodule.Quotient.mk (p := (I ^ m • ⊤ : Submodule R M)) x :=
   rfl
```

Which is the simp normal form? `eval I M n f` or `f.1 n`? You should choose one and design the simp lemmas around it. If it is the former, than this lemma should be stated with it. If it is the latter, `AdicCompletion.eval_apply` should be a simp lemma and `val_add`, `val_sub`, `val_smul`, `val_zero` simp lemmas should be added.

The simp NF is `f.1 n` because of `AdicCompletion.coe_eval` being a simp lemma. That's why `AdicCompletion.eval_apply` can't be a simp lemma currently, because it is already proven by `simp`. Are you saying that `eval_apply` should be the simp lemma instead of `coe_eval`?

For the time being, I added the simp lemmas you suggested. Anyway, I am not entirely sure whether the simp NF should not be `eval I M n f` instead, because it unveils less of the internal implementation of `AdicCompletion`. It might also be easier to control in the `Algebra` case, since then there are two "canonical" projections. The one to `R ⧸ (I ^ n • ⊤)` (`eval I R n`) and the one to `R ⧸ I ^ n` (`evalₐ I n` which is defined in the Algebra PR).
I didn't notice that `AdicCompletion.coe_eval` is a simp lemma. And I prefer `f.1 n` being simpNF as well.

```suggestion
@[simps] def AdicCauchySequence.mk (f : ℕ → M)
```
Maybe?
Seems to produce something useful, yes.
Can you add simp lemmas such as `(f + g).1 x = f.1 x + f.2 x`?
Maybe `CoeFun (AdicCauchySequence I M) (ℕ → M)`?

```suggestion
  choose a ha using fun n ↦ Submodule.Quotient.mk_surjective _ (x.val n)
```

```suggestion
    exact (f.property hmn).symm⟩
```

```suggestion
  toFun := fun x ↦ ⟨fun n ↦ f n x, fun hkl ↦ LinearMap.congr_fun (h hkl) x⟩⟩
```

```suggestion
    rwa [isAdicCauchy_iff]
```
Can you split out the second half of this lemma into `eval_surjective`?

```suggestion
theorem ext {x y : AdicCompletion I M} (h : ∀ n, x.1 n = y.1 n) : x = y :=
```
And also maybe add `ext_iff`?

```suggestion
    transitionMap I M hmn (Submodule.Quotient.mk x) =
      Submodule.Quotient.mk x := by
```
I think this works and looks cleaner, but the current statement is also fine if you prefer explicitness.

Removing the explicit annotations makes this significantly slower (measured by eye). IMHO it might be a good idea to make `p` an explicit argument of `Submodule.Quotient.mk`, as the unification (at least that's what I think it is) seems to be quite slow there. Note that the ideal argument of `Ideal.Quotient.mk` is also explicit.
Maybe a simp lemma `f.1 x = f x` if the latter is simp NF.
This is proven by `simp`, should I add it anyway?

Oh maybe coefun is reducible or something similar.
I think the lemma might still be useful though?
CI says "LHS equals RHS syntactically", so I removed it again.
Ah coefun is smarter than I think. Sorry for the confusion.

```suggestion
lemma eval_lift (f : ∀ (n : ℕ), M →ₗ[R] N ⧸ (I ^ n • ⊤ : Submodule R N))
```

```suggestion
lemma lift_apply (f : ∀ (n : ℕ), M →ₗ[R] N ⧸ (I ^ n • ⊤ : Submodule R N))
```
(or `lift_apply_apply` or `eval_lift_apply`)

```suggestion
theorem induction_on {p : AdicCompletion I M → Prop} (x : AdicCompletion I M)
```
